casebody.data:
FAYETTE W. PIERCE, et al., Plaintiffs and Appellants, v. PAUL S. BROWN, et al., Defendants and Respondents.

Before Curtis and Sedgwick, JJ.

Heard January, 1876 ; Decided February 7, 1876. M. Compton, for appellant. Le Roy S. Gove, for respondent M. S. Brown. Mortimore Sanford,, for respondent P. S. Brown. The complaint was dismissed in the court below, and judgment was recovered by defendants. Curtis, J.,

wrote for affirmance, holding that the evidence failed to sustain the cause of action alleged in the complaint.

Sedgwick, J., concurred.
